content:
IN 2016 Madonna was honoured at a music industry awards ceremony. In her speech, she reflected on her 34 years in the business, her rap-span">extraordinary success as the best-selling female artist of all time and her talent for shocking people. She said something that was, true to form, startling. “People say I’m rap-span">controversial. But I think the most rap-span">controversial thing I have ever done is to stick around.”

Asked to identify Madonna’s most scandalous moment, this is not the answer that most people would give. rap-span">Foremost among her many rap-span">provocations are the music video for “Like a rap-span">Prayer” (1989), which the Vatican rap-span">condemned as rap-span">blasphemous, her simulation of rap-span">masturbation during her rap-span">Blond Ambition tour in 1990, and “Sex” (1992), an rap-span">erotic photo-book chronicling her sexual rap-span">adventures with both men and women. The idea that these events could be erap-span">clipsed by the rap-span">mere rap-span">longevity of Madonna’s career seems odd, until you remember how sexist and rap-span">ageist the music industry is. In her speech she said that a woman who continues to make music even as she gets older is treated as guilty of a kind of sin. Well, here I am, Madonna seemed to say. Guilty.

She remains unrepentant. Madonna, who turned 60 last August, is back with a new album. Released on June 14th, “rap-span">Madame X” finds her in her darkest mood since “American Life” (2003). “Things have got to change,” she sings on the rap-span">hypnotic “Batuka”, “there’s a storm ahead”. Enter Madonna’s alter-ego, rap-span">Madame X. A spy working undercover as a teacher, rap-span">nun and cha-cha-cha rap-span">instructor—but who nonetheless never removes her rap-span">conspicuous rap-span">crystal-rap-span">encrusted eye rap-span">patch—rap-span">Madame X is on a mission to cast off the chains of the rap-span">oppressed. Who the rap-span">oppressors are is never entirely certain, but they must be rap-span">located in Brazil, rap-span">Colombia, rap-span">Portugal and rap-span">Atlanta, Georgia, because it is the sounds of those places that supply the soundtrack to her quest.

Much of “rap-span">Madame X” seems calculated to appeal to younger listeners. Her rap-span">persona is on-trend: it’s cool to care about the issues, and rap-span">Madame X cares. “God Control” rap-span">laments the fact that nothing is being done to stop mass shootings in American high schools; “I Rise” starts with a rap-span">clip from an rap-span">impassioned speech by Emma González, one of the teenage survivors of the shooting in Parkland, Florida, in 2018. “rap-span">Madame X” is woke—sometimes a little too woke. On “Killers Who Are Partying”, she sings about identifying with the rap-span">downtrodden (“I will be gay, if the gay are burned / I will be Africa, if Africa is shut down”). On “Come Alive”, she sings “All I want is peace, peace, peace”.

Over the years, Madonna has hired producers to help her weave the rap-span">genres du jour into her music, and sometimes those producers have gone rap-span">overboard. If you didn’t already know that “Hard Candy” (2008), produced by R’n’B hitmakers Timbaland and the Neptunes, was a Madonna record, you might have thought the singer was rap-span">Britney rap-span">Spears. By contrast, the producers of “rap-span">Madame X”—among them Mirwais and Diplo—understand how to update her sound. On “rap-span">Crave”, Madonna sings over the skittering high hats and big bass of trap, smoothing the edges of this spare, rap-span">flinty style of hip-hop until it becomes a wistful rap-span">lullaby. On the sweaty, sultry “Medellín”, Madonna’s rap-span">melancholy lyrics give new depth to reggaeton, a rap-span">genre of Latin dance music as seductive as it is superficial.

“rap-span">Madame X” is no “rap-span">Erotica”—there are no controversies on this album—but that is not to say that Madonna isn’t experimenting. Since she moved to rap-span">Portugal in 2017, she has been exploring the sounds of the Lusophone rap-span">diaspora, as is rap-span">audible on the most intriguing tracks on “rap-span">Madame X”. “Batuka” riffs on batuque, a traditional dance music from rap-span">Cape rap-span">Verde rap-span">notable for its call-and-response structure, but adds syncopated handclaps and rap-span">crescendoing drums to rap-span">hypnotic effect. With its sirens, whistles and rap-span">chirrups, “Faz Gostoso” is a carnivalesque take on rap-span">Brazilian rap-span">funk on which Madonna and Anitta, a rap-span">Brazilian singer, rap in rap-span">Portuguese.

All the same, this reviewer could not help longing for a rap-span">glimpse of Madonna the rap-span">rap-span">provocateur. She is right to argue that she is taking a stand against the music industry rap-span">merely by making records at her age, but she could be more ambitious. During the height of her career, in the 1980s and 1990s, Madonna presented society with a new model of rap-span">femininity: the woman who was unafraid to rap-span">brazenly rap-span">flaunt her sexuality. She inspired a slew of rap-span">imitators from Ms rap-span">Spears to Miley rap-span">Cyrus. Now that Madonna is 60, and still backed by millions of fans, the opportunity has rap-span">arisen for her to scandalise the public once again. She could show listeners what it is like to be an older woman, one who embraces her sensuality yet is not afraid to reveal her wrinkles and talk about rap-span">menopause. That would be truly surprising.

eg2: First and , we believe that they wish to take away our property.
首先也是最重要的是，我们相信他们要剥夺我们的财产。
, reading to your children is vital, as is specific exercises and games to teach them letter names and sounds.
首先，给你的孩子朗读是必不可少的，因为这是教孩子字母名称和读音的特殊练习和游戏。
I believe they thought they were doing the right thing, but if I'd been any other victim, my wishes would have come .
我相信他们觉得自己在做的事是对的。 但如果我是任何其他的受害者，我的意愿将是最重要的。

eg2: to say your prayers

prayers for the sick
为病人的祈祷
He arrived at that very moment, as if in answer to her prayer .
他就在那一刻到了，好像是她的祈祷应验了。
Their prayers were answered and the child was found safe and well.
他们的祷告应验了：小孩找到了，安然无恙。
It was a prayer she had learnt as a child.
这是她儿时就学会了的祈祷文。
They knelt in prayer.
他们跪下祈祷。
We believe in the power of prayer.
我们相信祈祷的力量。
My prayer is that one day he will walk again.
我的企盼就是有一天他能重新走路。

eg2: After over a decade of production use, though, no other serious competitor has yet .
虽然经过十多年生产使用，但却没出现其它有力的竞争对手。
Like many new concepts implemented in different ways in different places, a lot of confusion has  between the concept and the implementation.
像在不同地方以不同方式实现的许多新概念一样，在概念和实现之间出现了许多混乱。
Although we may create and then use a pattern on the same project – we are likely to have come across similar situations in the past, and see that a pattern opportunity has .
虽然我们可能会在同一个项目中创建并使用模式，但我们也很可能会在过去碰到过类似的情况，并认为这种模式出现的可能性很大。

ex: adj. 听得见的

wp.audible sound: 可听声;可听音;可听见的声音;可闻声
wp.audible frequency: 声频;		可听频率;音频
wp.audible misfire: 听得到的发动机不着火

eg2: A noise was  in the house; it was the Lark sweeping the stairs.
在那所房子里，只听见一种声音，就是百灵鸟扫楼梯的声音。
We are constantly surrounded by noise, most of which is not  to us unless we hold something like a seashell close to one of our ears.
我们处在不断的杂音包围之中，其中大部分杂音我们是听不见的，除非把贝壳之类的东西靠近耳边才能听到。
A particularly fine spring came round, and the stir of germination was almost  in the buds; it moved her, as it moved the wild animals, and made her passionate to go.
一个特别明媚的春天来到了，几乎听得见苞芽里生命的萌动；春天就像激励野外的动物一样激励了她，使她要急切离开这里。

ex: adj. 亵渎神明的；不敬神的
eg2: Most Muslims consider representations of the Prophet Muhammad to be .
大多数穆斯林认为，对先知默罕默德的呈现是亵渎神明。
Once the temple—a masterpiece, of course—is complete, Toohey denounces it as , and pushes Stoddard to sue Roark for breach of contract.
一旦这所教堂完工（当然是一个杰作），图希就谴责它亵渎神明，并怂恿斯托达德以违反合同为由起诉罗克。
This is a  lie; and the fact that it is on the lips of every nurserymaid does not excuse it in the least.
而这简直就是亵渎上帝的谎言；并且事实上从每 位保姆的口中都不会听到一丁点类似宽恕这种谎言的话。

ex: adv. 厚脸皮地，厚颜无耻地
eg2: Some, like Cosco, a shipping giant, have  tried to renege on contracts.
有些公司，比如航运巨头中国远洋运输公司厚颜无耻地试图毁约。
Some wore hoods up and scarves to mask their faces but others brazenly walked in.
有些人戴着帽兜和围巾掩盖面部，但另一些人则明目张胆地走进去。
I watched hooded youths brazenly running up my road towards the store.
我看见带着头巾的年轻人们沿着我家门口的路跑向商店。

ex: n. 编年史，年代记；记录
vt. 记录；把…载入编年史
eg2: As a witness to events, the photojournalist sets out to chronicle what happens in the world as it actually occurs.
作为事件的见证人，摄影记者着手记录世界上所发生的事就如同其真实重现一般。
But sorrow and its implications cannot be banished entirely from this chronicle of their contentment.
然而，在记录他们的幸福与知足之时，影片也没有忽视其中悲伤及其背后的含义。
For example, the  of Higher Education recently reported on the plight of California’s community college students.
举例来说，高等教育编年史最近报道了加利福尼亚社区大学学生的困境。

ex: v. 剪辑；修剪；削减；固定

eg2: a hair clip
发夹
toe clips on a bicycle
自行车上的踏脚夹套
a diamond clip
钻石别针
He gave the hedge a clip.
他把树篱修剪了一下。
Here is a clip from her latest movie.
这是她最新电影的片段。
She gave him a clip round the ear for being cheeky.
她因他放肆给了他一记耳光。
He clipped the microphone (on) to his collar.
他把麦克风别在衣领上。
Clip the pages together .
把这些散页夹在一起。
Do those earrings clip on?
那些耳环是夹戴的吗？
to clip a hedge
修剪树篱
He clipped off a length of wire.
他剪掉了一段金属线。
The car clipped the kerb as it turned.
汽车转弯时撞上了马路牙子。
She clipped the ball into the net.
她把球斜推入网。
to clip a coupon (out of the paper)
（从报纸上）剪下赠券

ex: vt. 谴责；判刑，定罪；声讨
eg2: We condemn all sorts of slanders.
我们谴责一切诽谤中伤的言论。
Most people condemn war.
大多数人都谴责战争。
We all condemn cruelty to women and children.
大家一致谴责虐待妇女儿童的行径。

wp.conspicuous a: 明显的;显眼的;惹人注目的;显而易见的

ex: adj. 显著的；显而易见的
eg2: But their displays of support for the protesters were conspicuous throughout the capital.
但是他们支持示威者的却在整个首都表现得很明显。
What the drawing is trying to express is very .
这幅图试图表达的信息是非常明显的。
This was the least conspicuous of the many curious aspects of my arrest and trial.
对我的逮捕和审讯有很多可疑之处，这还是其中最不起眼的。

wp.controversial issues: 无争议的问题;争议的问题;争论性问题

ex: adj. 有争议的；有争论的
eg2: They tried their best to run away from controversial issues.
他们尽力避开有争议的问题。
As a controversial public figure he has breasted much hostile criticism.
作为一名有争议的公众人物，他毅然对付了许多带有敌意的批评。
I realize my saying this is controversial and differs from what we hear from mainstream news sources.
我认识到我的说法是有争议的，而且跟我们从主流新闻来源听到的不一样。

ex: n. 争论；论战；辩论
eg2: What do you think about this ongoing ?
你是怎样看待这场持续的争论呢？
Although endured a lot of discussion and  for a while because of its title.
虽然忍受了一段时间大批的争议和论战，就因为那个书名。
A bitter controversy about the siting of the airport is rumbling in the designing institute.
设计院里正吵吵嚷嚷着对机场选址问题作激烈争论。

a total/partial eclipse
全蚀；偏蚀
The election result marked the eclipse of the right wing.
选举结果标志着右翼的失势。
Her work was in eclipse for most of the 20th century.
她的作品在 20 世纪大部分时间里都湮没无闻。
Though a talented player, he was completely eclipsed by his brother.
他虽是个天才运动员，但与他的哥哥相比就黯然失色了。

ex: vt. 包上外壳；装饰外层

eg2: Obviously, the words “” and “vomiting” are not often used together.
显然，“性爱”与“呕吐”这两个词很少放在一起使用。
And here I want to stop because at some point you say that with the erotic we can enjoy the presence of someone for whom we don't have libidinal desires.
我想在这停一下因为你在某处说,有了厄洛斯的性爱，我们可以享受与某人在,一起的快乐，而对他/她没有力比多的欲望。
That, they suggest, is an  posture.
他们指出，那是性爱的姿势。

ex: adj. 非凡的；特别的；离奇的；特派的
eg2: I am an extraordinary person.
我是一个非凡的人。
He is a man of extraordinary will power.
他是个具有非凡意志的人。
And I have to tell you – it’s been .
然后我要告诉你的是─这是特别的体验。

ex: n. 温柔；柔弱性；女子本性
eg2: In fact, most women in Sweden find it easy to meld femininity with feminist ideals.
实际上，大部分瑞典女性发现很容易将妇女的柔弱性和女权主义理想融合。
But I can see why any clever actor would be drawn to play Thatcher – the woman is the ultimate drama queen, performing "" when it suited her.
但我明白为什么任何聪明的演员都会被饰演撒切尔所吸引——撒切尔是终极戏剧皇后，在合适的时候表现出“女人本性”。
The saccharine, confectionary pink objects that fill my images of little girls and their accessories reveal a pervasive and culturally manipulated expression of ” and a desire to be seen.
我相片中呈现的这些小女孩和她们如糖果般甜蜜的粉红色物品揭示了一种无所不在的女性柔性文化和她们急于展示自我的欲望。

ex: vt. 炫耀；飘扬
vi. 飘扬；夸耀
n. 炫耀；飘扬；招展
eg2: I also believe those who flaunt their nudity are inconsiderate and selfish.
我也相信那些炫耀他们裸体的人是自私的不体谅人的。
China sees the Expo, like the 2008 Beijing Olympics, as a chance to flaunt its strength.
中国把世博会看成是2008年北京奥运会来炫耀它的力量的一种机会。
Kyoto doesn't flaunt its wares: temples, pebble gardens and imperial palaces stand concealed among office blocks.
京都并没有炫耀自己的物品：寺庙、日式庭院和皇宫隐藏在办公楼中间。

ex: adj. 坚硬的；燧石似的；坚定不移的

wp.Funk Style: 放克风格;疯克舞;克风格

ex: n. 恐惧；怯懦；恐怖；臭味
vt. 害怕；畏缩；使闻到臭味
vi. 惊恐；畏缩；发出臭味
n. (Funk)人名；(瑞典、德、罗、匈、捷)丰克；(英)芬克
eg2: The markets have snapped out of their funk this month.
这个月，市场迅速走出了恐惧状态。
Instead I'll tell you how I got out of my entrepreneurial .

wp.superficial gastritis: 浅表性胃炎;性胃炎;非萎缩性胃炎;表浅性的胃发炎
wp.superficial hardening: 表面硬化;表面淬火;的翻译是表面硬化
wp.superficial compaction: 分层夯实;		表面压实

eg2: Happily, there was no apparent discomfort to any of the animals, although therewere some changes in pigmentation and superficial damage to the skin.
令人高兴的是，虽然有某些色素沉着的改变和皮肤表面的损伤，这些动物没有出现明显的不适。
The only problem is that you have no system to what you do, you shadow them and copy the superficial parts of their life and get exhausted doing it.
问题是你对自己所做的没有一个系统的整体概念。 你只是跟随模仿了他们生活中表面的一部分，最终只会感到疲惫。
Filial piety should not be expressed via  “performance”, but via children’s genuine care and love for their parents.
孝顺不应该通过表面的“表演”来表现，而是应该通过孩子们对父母真正的关爱来表达。

ex: adj. 出汗的；吃力的；使人出汗的
eg2: And bring the bottle with you, since even so-called "waterproof" sunscreens don't last the length of a long,  workout.
带一整瓶的防晒霜，因为即使那些号称“防水”的防晒霜在出汗的训练中也不能持续多长时间。
Researchers at the University of Manchester, in northwest England, said on Thursday that the biggest problems were sweaty palms, limp wrists, gripping too hard and lack of eye contact.
在英格兰西北部的大学调查研究人员曼彻斯特说，在星期四最大的问题就是出汗的手腕、手掌，紧握和没有直视对方眼睛。
In this iteration of the tale, Peter Parker is a pedant with sweaty palms and weak posture.
在对故事的重述中，彼得帕克是一个有着爱出汗的手掌和虚弱姿态的书呆子。

ex: vt. 切分；词中省略，缩写
adj. 不怕的；无畏的
eg2: Google, though, is a company  to experiment.
不过谷歌是一家不怕实验的公司。
And what need had he of these things in a new country where the most ignorant of bogtrotters had made great fortunes? in this country which asked only that a man be strong and  of work?
而且，在一个新的国家，在一个连那些最愚昧的爱尔兰人也在此发了大财的国家，在一个只要求你强壮不怕干活的国家，他需要这些东西干什么呢？
But King David was  to ask, "Why, O Lord, do you stand far off?
但是大卫王不怕问，“耶和华啊，你为什么站在远处？

ex: adj. 秘密的，秘密从事的；从事间谍活动的
eg2: Months went by without a peep from the FBI surveillance teams that had been tracking her in  vehicles and helicopters.
他曾经被秘密地由汽车和直升机跟踪，而联邦调查局跟踪小组有几个月没有窥视她了。
The informant, going by the pseudonym of "Sonia, " claims to be one of many undercover spys working in Mexico.
该告密者化名为“索尼娅”，声称自己是众多在墨西哥秘密工作的间谍中的一员。

ex: adj. 顽固不化的；不后悔的
eg2: Maurice Papon, the Paris police chief who instigated the killings, only died four years ago, aged 96; and some of his unrepentant and unpunished henchmen still remain at large.
唆使杀戮的巴黎警察局长莫里斯·帕庞，仅仅死于四年之前，终龄96岁；而他手下冥顽不化而未受惩罚的心腹亲信仍有很多还活着。

ex: n. 哨子；口哨；汽笛；汽笛声
v. 吹口哨；吹哨子；打呼哨；鸣叫
网络 口哨声；哨声响起；鸣笛
eg2: The referee finally blew the whistle to stop the game.
主裁判终于吹停了比赛。
He scored the winning goal just seconds before the final whistle.
他就在终场哨声前的几秒钟内打进了制胜的一球。
a shrill whistle
尖厉的口哨声
The train whistle blew as we left the station.
我们离开车站时火车的汽笛响了。
a factory whistle
工厂的汽笛
to whistle a tune
用口哨吹曲子
He whistled in amazement.
他惊愕地吹了个口哨。
The crowd booed and whistled as the player came onto the field.
那队员上场时，人群又是发出呸呸声又是吹口哨。
She whistled to the dog to come back.
她打了个呼哨把狗唤回来。
Workmen whistled at her as she walked past.
当她走过时工人向她吹口哨。
The referee whistled for a foul.
裁判吹哨子示意有人犯规。
The kettle began to whistle.
烧水壶呜呜地响了起来。
The microphone was making a strange whistling sound.
扩音器发出一种奇怪的哨音。
The wind whistled down the chimney.
风飕飕地灌进烟囱。
A bullet whistled past his ear.
子弹嗖的一声从他耳边飞过。

ex: adj. 渴望的；沉思的，默想的；引起怀念的；不满足似的
eg2: Brown can also be sad and .
褐色也象征着悲伤与渴望。
Whereas wild animals like wolves will avert their eyes when spotted, dogs and cats readily return our gaze, and with an apparent emotiveness that stimulates the wistful narrative in our head.
然而像狼这样的野生动物通常会躲避人类的直视，而猫狗则乐于回应我们的注目，而且还带有明显的情感表露，刺激了人脑中的叙事渴望。
We could see them 3 kilometers off in the distance, and it was kind of a wistful feeling.
我们能在3公里外看到那些山丘，当时有一种可望而不可及的感觉。

ex: n. 皱纹；褶皱；小问题；妙计
v. 皱起…；(把织物,纸张等)弄皱；（使）起褶皱
网络 起皱；皱褶；起皱纹
eg2: There were fine wrinkles around her eyes.
她眼角上出现了鱼尾纹。
She wrinkled up her nose in distaste.
她厌恶地皱起鼻子。
He wrinkled his brow in concentration.
他全神贯注地锁紧眉头。
His face wrinkled in a grin.
他咧嘴一笑满脸都是皱纹。
Her stockings were wrinkling at the knees.
她长袜的膝盖处起了褶皱。

Title: Madonna remains scandalous, but for the wrong reason
